text: The 2019–20 season was Dundee United's 111th season, having been founded as Dundee Hibernian in 1909. It was their fourth season in the Scottish Championship, having been relegated from the Scottish Premiership at the end of the 2015–16 season. United also competed in the Challenge Cup, League Cup and Scottish Cup. On 15 April, the SPFL voted to end the lower leagues in Scottish football due to the coronavirus pandemic and as a result Dundee United were declared champions and secured promotion to the Premiership after four years in the Championship. ==Competitions== === Results & fixtures === ===Pre-season=== ===Scottish Championship=== ===Scottish Challenge Cup=== ===Scottish League Cup=== ===Scottish Cup=== ==Club statistics== === League table === === Group A Table === ==Transfers== ===In=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:95%;width:98%; text-align:left" |- !Player !From !Fee |- | Liam Smith | Ayr United |Free |- | Adrián Sporle | Banfield |Free |- | Lawrence Shankland | Ayr United |Free |- | Deniz Mehmet | Queen of the South |Free |- | Adam King | Swansea City |Free |- | Dillon Powers | Orlando City |Free |} ===Out=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:95%;width:98%; text-align:left" |- !Player !To !Fee |- | Aidan Nesbitt | Greenock Morton |Free |- | Morgaro Gomis | Falkirk |Free |- | Adam Barton | Wrexham |Free |- | Lewis Toshney | Falkirk |Free |- | Declan Glass | Cove Rangers |Loan |- | Rachid Bouhenna | Sepsi OSK |Free |- | Callum Booth | St Johnstone |Free |- | Matty Smith | Cove Rangers |Loan |- | Frédéric Frans | Lierse |Loan |- | Osman Sow | Kilmarnock |Loan |- | Logan Chalmers | Arbroath |Loan |- | Scott Banks | Crystal Palace |Free |- | Sam Stanton | Phoenix Rising |Free |- | Matty Smith | Waterford |Free |- | Cammy Smith | Dundalk |Loan |} ==See also== * List of Dundee United F.C. seasons ==References== Category:Dundee United F.C. seasons Dundee United
